thread.title: Bulletin Board 2
thread.title_full: Bulletin Board for Oct. 2 - Sports - The Buffalo News

author: buffalonews
title: Bulletin Board 2
text:
Former Buffalo Bandits player Barry Powless has been selected for the Upstate New York Chapter of the United States Lacrosse Hall of Fame. Powless is an original Bandit, having played three games for the team in its first season of 1992. He had a fine career at Syracuse University, finishing in 1976, and went on to play in several Canadian leagues in the ’70s and ’80s. Powless was named the first coach of the Rochester Knighthawks in 1995, and won a championship in 1997. The induction ceremony is Oct. 18 in the Syracuse area.
...
BASKETBALL: The Buffalo Titans and Hilbert College women’s basketball are hosting a coaches clinic on Saturday, Oct. 10 at Hilbert College. Women’s coaches will speak from 10 a.m. to 12:30 p.m., featuring Jada Pierce (Niagara University), Scott Hemer (SUNY Geneseo), and Dave Skolen (Daemen College). Men’s coaches will follow from 1 to 3:30 p.m., featuring speakers Mark Linebaugh (Hobart College), Russ Phillips (Alfred University), and Jason Leone (SUNY Oswego). Registration is $45 per organization. To register, visit buffalotitans.com.
HALL OF FAME: The Sweet Home athletic hall of fame will induct its class of 2015 on Oct. 9 at 6 p.m. at Banchetti’s in Amherst. All tickets are $40 with cash bar. For information, contact Mike at usa97@roadrunner.com . This year’s class includes the 2000 New York State field hockey champions, Dr. Gary Cooper, Aaron Mitchell, Rachael Rush, Lauren Stiver and Katrina Woznek.
HOCKEY: Cory Mickey Hockey Training will hold a Columbus Day Clinic on Monday, Oct. 12 from 9 a.m. to noon at Amherst Northtown Center. The focus of the clinic will be finishing with the puck and completing the simple plays. To reserve your spot, email cory.mickey@gmail.com and send checks payable to Cory Mickey Hockey Training (60 Roxbury Park, E. Amherst, NY 14051).
SOCCER: Sahlen Sports Park is currently looking for boys and girls youth soccer players for its U10 and U11 Euro Champions program. Visit SahlenSportsPark.com for more information, or call Aaran Lines at (716) 655-PLAY.
SOFTBALL: The Gowanda Octoberfest Men’s Softball Tournament will be held Oct. 10 beginning at 11 a.m. There will be awards for each team and a home run derby. The entry fee is $100. To register your team, call Mark Benton at 532-4053 or email hidibenton@aol.com .
... Xtreme Fastpitch Softball is looking for an experienced catcher to round out their 12U roster, 2003 birth year. Contact Mary Beth Dreyer at mbdreyer@gmail.com .
The Bulletin Board appears Tuesday and Friday. Information must be submitted by mail (c/o Buffalo News, Sports Dept., One News Plaza, Buffalo, NY 14240) or email ( sports@buffnews.com ). There is no charge.
